Posts.Content: rue2u wrote: Hi all, I am waiting on results from an endometrial biopsy. I have completed my treatment almost two years ago: 4 rounds of AC, 33 rads, currently on Tamoxifen. Had 4 month peroid during AC chemo and then stopped periods during rads. Haven't had a period for about 1 1/2 years and now spotting again. Have had two pelvic ultrasounds and now my second endometrial biopsy. Have stopped Tamoxifen for the moment. Hope to get results on Friday. Actually have a grandmother who died of uteran cancer so I was quite apprehensive about starting Tamoxifen. Hoping for B9. Thanks all! Rue Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Endometrial Biopsy rue2u leaf

Posts.Content: Sep 21, 2007 06:33AM rue2u wrote: Geeta and Kimmy, Thanks for letting us know about the florist.  I called her at 6:30 AM PT.  She told me to go back to bed!  She did say she has received many calls for Shelli and that she must have been a great lady.  I hope she has a beautiful service. Rue
Posts.Title: Shelli's Obituary and Flower info geeta75 spicecakeforever
uterus thickening & tamoxifen waiting on biopsy edwh001 lalisa

Posts.Content: Sep 19, 2007 12:04AM rue2u wrote: You are amazing and I know that you are bound to this world because of the love you feel and receive.  We are so thankful to you for your help on the boards and to your family for sharing your world with us.  I always think of my favorite Robert Frost poem in times like this and hope you enjoy it too: Two roads diverged in a yellow wood, And sorry I could not travel both And be one traveler, long I stood And looked down one as far as I could To where it bent in the undergrowth; Then took the other, as just as fair, And having perhaps the better claim, Because it was grassy and wanted wear; Though as for that the passing there Had worn them really about the same, And both that morning equally lay In leaves no step had trodden black. Oh, I kept the first for another day! Yet knowing how way leads on to way, I doubted if I should ever come back. I shall be telling this with a sigh Somewhere ages and ages hence: Two roads diverged in a wood, and I- I took the one less traveled by, And that has made all the difference. Rue
Posts.Title: I love Shelli because....... geeta75 rue2u

Posts.Content: Sep 19, 2007 08:38PM rue2u wrote: Geeta, This is an especially sad time for us all.  I am glad she is free from pain and in a much better place.  My prayers and sympathy to Sandy, Stan, Karl, Hunter, Kara, and Olivia.  Shelli lives on in our memories and will be a resource for so many of us throughout our journey.  Sigh... Rue
